Question three

Using the concept of a Current Transformation Matrix (push/pop matrices), write the OpenGL or using whichever language code to define the object as illustrated below. Youmay assume that the object is composed of two squares and a circle of unit dimensions in 2D space.

class ObjectWithShapes

A class representing an object composed of squares and a circle in a 2D space.

Variables:

  • width (int) – The width of the image.

  • height (int) – The height of the image.

  • image (PIL.Image.Image) – The image object used for drawing shapes.

  • draw (PIL.ImageDraw.ImageDraw) – The drawing context for the image.

__init__(width, height)

Initializes an ObjectWithShapes instance.

Parameters:

  • width (int) – The width of the image.

  • height (int) – The height of the image.

draw_square(size, position)

Draws a square on the image.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – The size of the square.

  • position (tuple) – The position of the top-left corner of the square (x, y).

draw_circle(radius, position)

Draws a circle on the image.

Parameters:

  • radius (int) – The radius of the circle.

  • position (tuple) – The position of the center of the circle (x, y).

draw_object()

Draws a composition of a circle in the middle, a square to the left, and a square to the right.

show_image()

Displays the image.

main()

Main function to demonstrate the ObjectWithShapes class.

Constants:

  • width (int): The width of the image (300).

  • height (int): The height of the image (200).

Usage:

  • Create an instance of ObjectWithShapes.

  • Draw a composition of a circle in the middle, a square to the left, and a square to the right.

  • Display the image.

Example usage:

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
